heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.7°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 49.5°C), feels like temperature (up 53.6°C), outside temperature (up 51.0°C), and cloud levels (down 476 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 205.9m lower than yesterday, 565.8m higher than the past week, 476.4m higher than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1176m and a peak of 4770m, averaging 2280m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. Weather should be calm and steady.
